issue.title: [Feature]: record trace manually only on failure

repository.name: playwright
repository.description: Playwright is a framework for Web Testing and Automation. It allows testing Chromium, Firefox and WebKit with a single API.

issue.body:
### ðŸš€ Feature Request

Use the [manual tracing option](https://playwright.dev/docs/api/class-tracing) but save the trace only if the spec failed.

Same as 'retain-on-failure' for regular automatic tracing.

### Example

something like:

`await context.tracing.stop({ path: '${title}_${retry}/authentication-trace.zip', trace: 'retain-on-failure' });`

### Motivation

Currently, if you're using the [moderate authentication strategy by using workerStorageState](https://playwright.dev/docs/auth#moderate-one-account-per-parallel-worker) you need to [manually record this step](https://playwright.dev/docs/api/class-tracing) as it's not part of the spec trace, but this will resolve in a large amount of traces of this step - even if it passed.

body:
Any news on that? will it be fixed for the next version? @dgozman 
Thanks in advance

issue.title: feat(trace): record trace during context option fixture override

repository.name: playwright
repository.description: Playwright is a framework for Web Testing and Automation. It allows testing Chromium, Firefox and WebKit with a single API.

issue.title: chore: move artifacts recording to TestLifecycleInstrumentation

repository.name: playwright
repository.description: Playwright is a framework for Web Testing and Automation. It allows testing Chromium, Firefox and WebKit with a single API.

issue.body:
The spirit of this change is reverting #23153. Since that time, we have moved tracing and `artifactsDir` lifetime into the test runner, so the reason for revert is mitigated.

Fixes #30287, fixes #30718, fixes #30959.

body: @dgozman can you please tell me in which version this fix will be included? thanks!
@Danieliverant This should live in the next v1.45 release.

> @Danieliverant This should live in the next v1.45 release.

Thanks, working.

@dgozman it seems that if you have a timeout in the workerStorageState it still missing information

I updated the reproduction in the main thread inside my repo

issue.title: [Bug]: trace not recorded for "workerStorageState" on timeout

repository.name: playwright
repository.description: Playwright is a framework for Web Testing and Automation. It allows testing Chromium, Firefox and WebKit with a single API.

issue.body:
### Version

1.45.0

Following[ this bug that was fixed](https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/issues/30287), but not when the `workerStorageState` fails on timeout.

### Steps to reproduce

1. clone my repo - https://github.com/Danieliverant/playwright-no-trace
2. `cd playwright-no-trace`
3. `nx e2e e2e --trace on`
4. `npx playwright show-trace ./e2e/playwright-report/example-has-title-chromium/trace.zip`

(the test will fail)

### Expected behavior

To see the steps in the "wrokerStorageState"


### Actual behavior

Not seeing anything from the "wrokerStorageState"

![image](https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/assets/1301334/f369b9b0-1cf8-4864-a137-1ff4659ca2b1)

### Additional context

Same thing for UI mode - you wait until the "workerStorageState" to finish and only then you see the trace.


### Environment

```shell
System:
    OS: macOS 13.6
    CPU: (10) arm64 Apple M1 Pro
    Memory: 85.05 MB / 16.00 GB
  Binaries:
    Node: 18.10.0 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v18.10.0/bin/node
    npm: 8.19.2 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v18.10.0/bin/npm
  Languages:
    Bash: 3.2.57 - /bin/bash
  npmPackages:
    @playwright/test: 1.45.0
```

body:
opened a new issue with the reproduction of the timeout issue:

https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/issues/31530
